N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 158.5 - Award of grants

State Regulations

Grants shall be awarded to those boards of education and
boards of cooperative educational services which, in the judgment of the
commissioner, would be most effective in promoting community involvement to
strengthen education and the use of school facilities to enrich the life of
residents in the community. (a) In
awarding competitive program grants, the commissioner shall consider, but shall
not be limited to, the following factors: (1)
the extent to which the proposed education and community renewal program is
coordinated with existing school and community activities; (2)
the extent to which community members, agencies and institutions are willing to provide resources to strengthen
education; (3)
the identification
of specific school and community needs to be addressed by such
program; (4)
the extent to which
the proposed program increases the hours during which school resources are
available to students and the community; (5)
whether the applicant is in an
economically distressed area, as determined by the commissioner, or is a
district in need of academic improvement based on comprehensive assessment
reports, as determined by the commissioner; and
(6)
the quality of the program evaluation
plan; (b) In awarding
competitive training grants, the commissioner shall consider, but shall not be
limited to, the following factors: (1)
the
extent to which the proposed training agency has demonstrated experience and
effectiveness in operating education and community renewal programs as
described in this Part; (2)
the
extent to which the proposed training agency has demonstrated experience and
effectiveness in organizing staff development programs for staff of school
districts and boards of cooperative educational services; and
(3)
the ability of the proposed training
agency to provide required training at a reasonable expense. Notes
